KSL Hotel & Resort
7.6 Very good
Based on 23468 reviews

My children choose to book this hotel to celebrate my birthday and we check in around 9:30 p.m on 4th November 2017 .

Everything was good for a start with good service from the front office lady and she pass me my room key . After we check in to our room , we find out it was only a KING size bed which we actually book a Deluxe Twin meaning a Queen and a single bed . We took our luggage , went down to the front office and the front office staff mention that due to the high occupancy they have run out of the Deluxe Twin room and offer to place an additional roll up single bed into the room . I ask the see the manager as I find that if you have already collected the payment of the Twin Deluxe , what do they mean by high occupancy ? It sound pretty ridiculous and a joke to collect the money and then say no room available ? Was talking for almost 15 min before I met the duty manager and I told him that it is really disappointing to have such things happen that our family intend to celebrate my birthday which the kiddos have save up money to buy this hotel room . Not asking for anything but upon hearing it and usually in many other hotels that I have celebrate , usually they would offer to send in a slice of birthday cake or a bottle of wine to the room , but no birthday greetings was even being say .... Was surprise by the hotel service and even from a duty manager . But he is "cool" to offer 2 complimentary breakfast and told him that is only the room they have and I have to take it which I find it uncool . What a service offer by KSL hotel and wonder how AGODA will handle a situation like this ? But the kiddos love the swimming pool area and the bed is comfortable but it had cause the kiddos to be so disappointed to pay for a better room for the Deluxe Twin otherwise we would have taken the standard twin room . What a birthday staycation coming all the way from Singapore to celebrate here in KSL RESORT

Show more
Hotel Jen Puteri Harbour
8.3 Excellent
Based on 3062 reviews

Me and my 9 y.o. son had a great and memorable experience in Hotel Jen. I would like to take this opportunity to express how I am satisfied with the hotel's services, accommodatiin and amenities.

staff was helpful when we arrived (5-star treatment). and we just loved the room and everything in it. modern room interiors and beddings were so comfortable. i paid a little extra for the room with harbour view. me and my son had a memorable stay even its just an overnight for the purpose to visit legoland. and what's more?! hotel food is great. i could say the croissants included inthe american breakfast (room service) was the best I've tried. really a value for many if you want a place to relax and recharge in Johor while enjoying legoland. we also got the chance to enjoy the pool at the view deck w/ skybar resto bar (poolside) overlooking the harbour. our johor sidetrip was the best part of me and my son's short vacation. Thank you also to the efficient hotel staff. its one of the top things we look for when having a vacation in a top hotel.

Show more
Joyce , Philippines
Grand Paragon Hotel Johor Bahru
7.6 Very good
Based on 6486 reviews

First time stay here, Booked a deluxe room (newly renovated) with breakfast using Agoda. Checked in at 3pm and the unpleasant staycation started.

Was given a deluxe room that looks old. Cons: old room with no remote control for the a/c, got to wake up middle of the night walk to the door entrance to adjust room temperature. Limited space to put your toiletries at the shower area and shower pressure is low. There are 2 lift lobbies and I was given an old room with no direct access from the lift to the pool, need to go to ground level, walk to another lift lobby to get to the pool at level 11, and imagine you are wet after a swim. The pool is small, differs from the pics, not for a decent swim or workout. The worst part is day and night I could always hear water draining off to the drainage and it can be disturbing at night. There is a notice in the toilet that says under the penal code, theft is a crime and can be prosecuted. (Come on! Lol) Next day at 11am, I called and asked the front desk if I could have a late check out at 12.30pm? The staff told me I can check out at anytime before 1pm. But at 12.15pm, I received a call from a staff asking me what time am I going to checkout? Pros: Spacious, clean room with decent gym facilities. Breakfast is above average. Conclusion: For the price that I'm paying, the room and service are not up to my expectations, it's not value for money, I will not return unless the rate is lower. For the same rate that I have paid, I will go to Hxxxx Vxxx Hotel instead. 😊

Show more
Lim , Singapore
Doubletree by Hilton Hotel Johor Bahru
8.6 Excellent
Based on 2699 reviews

I am quite surprise on how this hotel got so many positive review. It is a good hotel but to call it 5 star is overkill.

At highest I can only give it 3 star. The only reason they call themselves 5 star are because it got Hilton name in it. Car park (2 star)- The car park are small. It is guarded by a guy who can't even speak Malay or English but generous in smile making communication really hard. And for a 5 star hotel, I am surprise the car park are not free. You need to pay RM 10 per night. BTW, don't use touch n go. They will charge you per hour rate. I pay a high sum of money to you and you can't even let go of the RM 10 park money. Really a dirty way to rip off our money. Check in (2 star)- The check-in is damn slow. I mean super slow for a "5" star hotel. It took us 20 minutes to check in and we are second in row. I also saw a couple foreigner going angry because they were in the hilton honors line but they have to take the same time as us to be treated. So what the purpose of being in your fancy hilton honor club if it is the same. But the good news is you got a warm cookies. Their signature trademark. The cookies are good. I mean really good. That is the only good thing about the hotel. They also promote us to enter the hilton honor club for free. They said the next time I want to book the hotel, I just need to call them directly, no need to use Agoda. You know why I book using Agoda, because I try calling them at the first place and they put me on-hold for almost 10 minute. Then they pick up just to put on another hold. It end up in a failure. I fed up and just book using Agoda. "5" star indeed. Internet- No wifi connection unless you are in the hilton honor club. Thats right, although you pay hefty sum of money for the night, you won't get any wifi connection. If you want, you need to pay for it. Services (4 star)- Well I can't deny it, they smile all the time and try so hard to greet you. You can feel how fake it is. But thats

Show more
Abdul , Malaysia
Mutiara Hotel Johor Bahru
7.9 Very good
Based on 6197 reviews

On 22nd to 23rd Sept 2017, when I called to request services thru Service Operator Dial 01 is so-called to blunt or too rush to end Guest needs in quickest way.

eg Oh really, and cut the call.On evening of 23rd Sept 2017, the duty Executive, Shahidah and Front Office agent, Taufik are the examplary employees as they provided solutions to my change of rooms due to bed bugs experienced.Shahidah kept asking if we require medical attention on nearby clinic and at same time, she gave us antiseptic cream to apply.She kept apologising on behalf of the hotel.We were overwhelmed by their professionalism to resolve.Taufik escorted us to new room and made us felt as A valued guest. I will definitely come back to stay in hotel as the hotel have good employees go beyond their call of duty to assure guests aside from my first night bad experienced.Thank you, Mutiara Hotel.

Show more
Mohamed , Singapore
Hotel Granada Johor Bahru
7.6 Very good
Based on 3754 reviews

We have book 2 room with indication of 4 adults and 2 kids age 6 and 8. As the booking have indicated the breakfast is included we have assume breakfast is for all of us.

When we went for breakfast at the hotel than was told the kids are not included for breakfast where there is no indicated on any place when we were doing the booking via Agoda. There is no indication of the price we have to pay for the kids breakfast as well. The only note where we may be billed is on the booking voucher which we will get only upon payment under the notes "In cases where breakfast is included with the room rate, please note that certain properties may charge extra for children travelling with their parents, the property will bill you directly. Upon arrival, if you have any questions, please verify with the property. I have feed back to Agoda that it would be good if there is a note under breakfast that breakfast is only for 2 or indicate that children breakfast is not included. This will actually make a difference in hotel choices for user with young kids since child breakfast is not included in the package which include for adult.

Show more
Eileen , Singapore
Amari Johor Bahru
8.8 Excellent
Based on 475 reviews

1) Location It is super convenient & very close to CIQ with just Komtar JBCC across the street. Within walking distances to the hip cafes down at Jln Dhoby & surrounded by shopping centres around, its truly a great place to be situated at if you love shopping.

2) Hotel Upon arrival, from the concierge to the front desk to the bell hop as well as the restaurants, i was greeted with warmth, smiles and a pleasant hospitality that is a kin to how the Thai hotels greet their guests. It made me feel so welcomed. The waiting lounge was nothing short of impeccable with its beautiful library full of books and top notch PCs with internet to a pool table for guests to interact with while waiting for their check-in. Every part of the hotel makes for an instagram worthy picture. 3) The room was huge! And it was incredibly beautiful! With a nice lounge chair, a work desk, a console that kept not only the minibar but the kettle, cups & TWG tea away to make the room clutter free. The room was equipped with a hair dryer, iron & ironing board so there's no need to pester to loan one. That king size bed is really luxurious to sleep in. If you don't really soft pillows, you might want to ask for more. The pillows were too soft for my liking. 4) Service I spent my birthday there & requested the room to be decorated. This part is one I am slightly disappointed it. Although I received a big cake that I adore & was complimentary (it was so yummy!), paying rm150 for just helium-filled balloons and a small banner on the bed to say Happy Birthday didn't cut it for me. There are so much things that can be done rather than just balloons for that price. 5) Restaurant Just check out their Facebook & you can see yourself drooling everywhere! It is exactly as what it is. I spent 2 hours sitting for breakfast & I still haven't tried everything that was made available. Everything was simply marvelously cooked to perfection in my opinion of course. Overall, would I come again

Show more
Nur , Singapore
Thistle Johor Bahru Hotel
7.7 Very good
Based on 6797 reviews

We checked in the hotel about 9.30 pm and wanted to order room service. First there was no room service menu in the room and it took 45 minutes for the front desk to get someone to bring it to us.

We ordered our food of total bill of RM123.00 and it was all good except the prawns that were served was spoiled kinda makes it not worth the amount i paid. Later we ordered a can of coke that never came. Heater was not working and again i took 45 mins for someone to come and he casually said 'oh u need to let the water run for 10 mins before it gets hot'. I use to look forward to my stay in thistle but i can see its quality slipping. hope this does not happen again

Show more
Navindran , Malaysia
Amerin Boutique Hotel Johor Bahru
7.8 Very good
Based on 1390 reviews

A very new hotel with friendly staff, I mentioned that NO CORNER ROOM for me but as the hotel are fully booked so the first night I was staying in a corner room which I dont really like it but they changed a new room for me for second night stay.

Cleanliness 5star, room was quite ok but not too big. Just the aircond problem, as management control the aircond temperature and the lowest was 21 degree and it was like OMG so hot! When we ask the staff to come inside to our room, he ask us to go outside for 5minute then go into the room again, then we will feel cold. Speechless! So for the two nights we sleep wihout using the blanket. But overall was ok

Show more
Tiew , Malaysia
Grand Bluewave Hotel
7.4 Very good
Based on 5886 reviews

Initially booked for a double bed room, but after I checked into room, what I got was the twin bed room.

Directly called to recep and got an answer of "sorry, we are forgot to inform you that no more double bed room today, only twin bed available. If you want to change room, please come to recep tomorrow and check again if they are available". I was like, booked for a double bed room and non-smoking room, what I've got is totally opposite, a twin bed and smoking room, some more a cigarette stain still on the carpet on the floor. If like this will happen, might as well don't need us to put a remark in the Agoda apps. And what I thought, if you don't have double bed, you could have do a better service like an upgrade our room like what other hotels did. Beside that, we also found a cockroach was hanging around the toilet, this is so unacceptable in terms of cleanliness. Overall, not a good stay for me.

Show more
Yan , Malaysia
Baguss City Hotel
7.2 Very good
Based on 3537 reviews

The price is pocket friendly..overall for 3 star hotel it was amazing stay,our room is very clean no stain no dirt n everything seems brand new, hotel staff very polite n for that a pocket friendly price i never expect for a good breakfast,but i was wrong because their provide a superb breaky ☺️ (Baked bean,toast,omellete corner,soto mie,lontong sayur,fried rice,cereal,fruits,however it means a lot for me n my children tummy 😬) n location is very best reason why i choose to stay here 👍🏻 Is there any cons? Yeah baguss city 95% baguss n very very baguss like their hotel named but only minus on tv channel bcoz it's only 8 local channel (if the hotel has cable tv truthly i give 100% baguss) overall,sure we"ll be back soon 😊

Tammy , Indonesia
Berjaya Waterfront Hotel
6.8 Good
Based on 5549 reviews

Good location of the hotel, but facilities is bad as in TV not working, access card not working, aircon not cold.

Given the last room to the far end. lobby dont link with car park elevator, need to walk very far from the car part to lobby for registration and walk again very far from lobby to my room. Difficult to find food in the hotel but you can find beer at any corner of this place. Room is spacious but empty. parking is very far you need to walk, and along the way is very quite and scary, i do not recommend women or girl walk alone from your room to car park if you going for this hotel. and your parking ticket is never work if you verify at the lobby, you still have to verify the ticket again at the car park office, it is so not convenience for the hotel guess. so what i learn here is, you get good discount but you will get a last room from the elevator and poor facilities. if you were ask me, i'd say i wont return to this hotel, even it is FREE..

Show more
choo , Malaysia
New York Hotel
7.1 Very good
Based on 3308 reviews

The room that I had was surprisingly nice although not pristine. Was supplied with only 1 toilet paper (single ply).

No safe in room. Television channels uninspiring and mostly fuzzy images. No cable TV, it’s all antenna. I had great views from my window. Reception staff were polite but lacked warmth. Not forthcoming in details. No directions given to find the way up to my room. Forgettable service. The elevators were slow except for the ones near the restaurant which was slightly faster and more scenic. Swimming pool doesn't seemed to be cleaned often. Water was icy cold. The jacuzzi was not operational. Steam and sauna were on demand. The price was okay until I was asked to pay for the tourism tax of MYR10. This was not included in the online pricing. If this tax was added to the online price, I’d be better informed on its value for money. Overall, I will stay again but only if the price is right. Will not pay more as the facilities and services were kinda uninspiring. Hope I will remember about the tourism tax in the future. It would be better if this website automatically include the tax in their quoted pricing.

Show more
Zulhairi , Singapore
Erica Hotel
6.5 Good
Based on 1934 reviews

when there with my friend, when we want to check in they gives us a coupon for breakfast, next morning when went for the breakfast, in the middle of our breakfast, suddenly there is this old lady that responsible letting people in for the breakfast came to us and suddenly told us that our room is not included with the breakfast, while we r still eating.

she came to us with very rude attitude, trying to chase us out. afterward she told the front lady that give us the coupon. the front desk staff came then explain to us their mistakes and wanted to deduct the price of the breakfast with our deposit! . we were really disspapointed with the staff. 1. first mistake was giving us the breakfast coupon 2. second, when we show the coupon she let us in without really check on the validity of the coupon. 3. trying to deduct our deposit, because of their mistakes . staff was really2 bad

Show more
mohd , Malaysia
The Puteri Pacific Johor Bahru
7.4 Very good
Based on 5384 reviews

I reserved the junior suite, however the room I got after checked in was definitely not the same as what I saw from the hotel website! And it was showing "corner suite" instead of "junior suite" on my room door.

Upon I returned to the front desk, I was told that there were only two junior suites with the new renovation in the hotel! I think it was totally a cheat and the picture in the hotel website is totally misleading! Everyone will assume all the junior suites look the same! Moreover the lady who checked in for me was not professional. She informed me that breakfast was not including for my stay and did not mention anything about the club benefit to me. When I used the phone in the room, I found all the fast keys were not working. Finally I reached the operator and was told all call will be handled by the operator and all the fast keys got no meaning at all. Is that mean the fast keys showing on the phone are using for display only? I really don't understand. On the next day morning, I was told that breakfast was not included in my room package in the restaurant again. Even she called to somewhere to clarify, but the answer was the same that breakfast was not included as I booked from Agoda. I found a box of chocolate with a name card under the name Wan Paris, the Executive Assistant Manager. So I tried to send him/her an email regarding my experience, but somehow the email address on the name card was not working. It was so funny.

Show more
Chan , Hong Kong
Citrus Hotel Johor Bahru by Compass Hospitality
7.1 Very good
Based on 7235 reviews

Location wise is good. Just right beside City square mall which connects to the checkpoint into Singapore.

The rooms need major refurbishment and maintenance. Had to change room 3 times. Room 1, Aircond issues. Room 2, Aircond issues. Room 3, television issue. To be honest, all the staff especially the manager Mr Jasvin was very friendly and attended to my problems promptly. The only downside is the lack of maintenance for the rooms. The issue with the aircond was that, it was making very loud noises. After a short talk with the maintenance revealed that they were awaiting spare parts for the aircond. Hopefully the aircond problems will be fixed. A good night's sleep is the most minimum requirement for a hotel regardless of their stars. Will come back again if the aircond issues are solved.

Show more
The Leverage Business Hotel (Skudai)
8 Very good
Based on 1180 reviews

I stayed at the Executive King room. Basically, I have no complaint on my first time experience with Leverage, though the room was small, all the basic facilities were there; complete set of toiletries, tea/coffee making facility, mini fridge, separate bath and toilet area ( which is very practical ), ironing facility, flat screen tv with varies channels.

Hotel employees were friendly, check in and check out processes were fast and efficient. This hotel is just 5 minutes drive away from Sutera Mall and within short distance to other amenities. Good for those who are driving. There are many public parking lots around the area and, of course, 'park at your own risk' . One has no worry about looking for food at midnight as there is a 24 hours Indian coffee shop serving tasty Indian food with reasonable price just 5 minutes walking distance away. My only disappointment was that there was no closet in the room as described at the booking site, and the clothes hanging area is too limited .I will likely to stay at this hotel again.

Show more
MING , Malaysia
V8 Hotel
7.8 Very good
Based on 845 reviews

8.2 Excellent
Based on 892 reviews

I booked 2 rooms from 11-12 Feb. Due to unforeseen family commitments, we only managed to check-in at 12am.

Check-in was a breeze and the staff allowed free late check-out at 2pm. The room is what's expected of a 5 star hotel. Clean, comfy bed and Tokyo Milk toiletries with latest hairdryer, iron, etc. You'll also get Nescafe normal and decaf 3 sticks each and Sir Thomas English and Green Tea, 2 each. Acceptable for a 1 night stay. But the highlight of our stay in Renaissance is the buffet breakfast. It differs from other hotels because of the unique spread. It's not that huge but it has cooks that are on standby, waiting to serve and cook on the spot for you such as grilled meats Mongolian style, Tepanyaki meat, seafood and veges, Mamak style roti prata, poori and dosai. For beverages, there's tea tarik or milo tarik made on the spot upon request just like when you ask for omelette (btw, the omelette is marvellous) and you can also get fresh fruit juices made upon request too. The bread section doesn't impress me though. A couple of multi-grains, croissants and sweet pastries. And sadly, they forgot my favorite donut. *sobs* Oh, for the kids, there's ice-cream with toppings such as shaved coconuts, chocolate chips, nuts, chocolate rice, etc. Parking is quite convenient and they have a 24 guard on duty. You just need to validate your ticket at the counter and the auto-machine at the lift-lobby whenever you need to leave the hotel. Swimming pool is normal. But their gym is open 24 hours. *smiles* Although the hotel looks old on the outside, but the inside is acceptable.

More about Johor Bahru

Johor Bahru is an important manufacturing and business hub for Malaysia just over the causeway from Singapore. This city isn’t known for drawing in droves of visitors, but it is a popular destination for Singaporeans, especially those traveling to shop. The city is served by both Senai International Airport and, across the border, Singapore's Changi Airport, and is linked to its neighbors via several arterial roads and sea ports. BR> Johor Bahru has several large malls, and as a manufacturing hub, goods are generally cheaper than in nearby Singapore. AEON Tebrau City Shopping Centre is a short drive from the city center and features several large chains and a cinema complex. Close to the Causeway is Holiday Plaza, offering discounted prices on electronics. Travelers can find handmade goods at the Johor Area Rehabilitation Organization Handicraft Centre.

When not shopping, modern and historical landmarks are popular sites to visit. A former palace, the Royal Abu Bakar Museum offers a glimpse into the lives of Johor’s royals within the grounds of a well-manicured garden. The Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception, built in 1883, is one of the oldest structures still standing in the city.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Johor Bahru for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

Show more Mariano ,Philippines plan your trip for few theme park in Johor Bahru, shopping, cafe hoping and trivel to Mersing for nice beaches and island. tahir ,Malaysia Discover the neighborhoods of Johor Bahru Gelang Patah/Legoland 290 hotels Tebrau 163 hotels Johor Bahru City Center 153 hotels Skudai 92 hotels Danga Bay 55 hotels Kempas 45 hotels Tampoi 44 hotels Masai 38 hotels Bandar Baru Permas Jaya 37 hotels Pulai 31 hotels Senai / Airport 27 hotels Larkin 23 hotels Johor Jaya 20 hotels Kulai Jaya 18 hotels Pasir Gudang 17 hotels Ulu Tiram 7 hotels Stulang Bahru 6 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Johor Bahru 246 Guest Houses in Johor Bahru 46 Hostels in Johor Bahru 11 Serviced Apartments in Johor Bahru 10 Resorts in Johor Bahru 5 Bungalows in Johor Bahru 1 More about Johor Bahru Johor Bahru is an important manufacturing and business hub for Malaysia just over the causeway from Singapore. This city isn’t known for drawing in droves of visitors, but it is a popular destination for Singaporeans, especially those traveling to shop. The city is served by both Senai International Airport and, across the border, Singapore's Changi Airport, and is linked to its neighbors via several arterial roads and sea ports. <>BR> Johor Bahru has several large malls, and as a manufacturing hub, goods are generally cheaper than in nearby Singapore. AEON Tebrau City Shopping Centre is a short drive from the city center and features several large chains and a cinema complex. Close to the Causeway is Holiday Plaza, offering discounted prices on electronics. Travelers can find handmade goods at the Johor Area Rehabilitation Organization Handicraft Centre. When not shopping, modern and historical landmarks are popular sites to visit. A former palace, the Royal Abu Bakar Museum offers a glimpse into the lives of Johor’s royals within the grounds of a well-manicured garden. The Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception , built in 1883, is one of the oldest structures still standing in the city. Be sure to check out the interactive map of Johor Bahru for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.
